info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 6:42PM MST until July 17 at 8:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 642 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorms that produced the earlier heavy rain have diminished. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Runoff from the earlier heavy rain will continue to pose a flash flood threat. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mt. Trumbull, Toroweap Campground and Tuweep. The Mt. Trumbull Loop and Antelope Valley Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
